title: Backend Java developer + Web
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****4-6 months**
  
We are a team working on driving free-to-paid conversion through our ownership of pages and equivalents on Android and iOS. Our surfaces are available to users globally and showcase the differences and benefits between using the free and paid versions of the products, as well as giving users the different options of plans. Beyond that, we cater to the market differences in terms of how we best explain the value proposition of the client's subscription, taking into account relevant policies, device differences and legal requirements that apply. Furthermore, we are working on making the experience more relevant to the user through different layers of personalization.  

  

As the owner of central surfaces in the user-journey we often are involved in cross-team work, critical company goals and product launches. We are very fast-paced and have a culture of helping teams that we work with with what they need. As a team we have a good mix of investigation and implementation work and a lot of opportunities to lead initiatives of all sorts of sizes and complexity, as well as learning from other disciplines as a very diverse team.  

  

What You’ll Do:  

* Work with an outstanding team of engineers on our conversion surfaces to drive growth and success for the wider company
* Work with squads across the Subscriptions mission and beyond on merchandising an increasingly complex product portfolio with complex regional and device requirements
* Ensure timely delivery of technical solutions to address business needs
* Collaborate with key internal partners and stakeholders to determine how to scalable design backend systems and APls

  

Who You Are:  

* You love collaborating with others and other disciplines
* You have 5+ years of proven experience working as a backend or fullstack engineer
* You have a foundational understanding of system design, data structures, and algorithms
* You have experience working directly with internal customers to understand, document and develop APls and systems to meet their requirements, driving increased adoption and reducing reliance on custom one-off implementations
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
* You have proven experience of Java backend stack
* You have proven experience of Web technologies

Start Date: 2025-07-14  

End Date: 2026-01-13


Location: Stockholm


  
Takin Kouchmeshki
Executive Area Manager


takin@emagine-consulting.se

description:

ASAP
 Duration
4-6 months
I’m interested


  
The Markets & Subscriptions team oversees the entire user journey on the company and ensures we engage with people in innovative ways, every step of the way. Our team grows clients' audiences by finding future listeners around the world and delivering the right value to them, at the right time. With research, product development, product design, engineering, and marketing all collaborating in one organization, we’re able to quickly create meaningful features and services for millions of people around the world, resulting in joyful, long-lasting relationships with the client.  

  

We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join a cross-functional team of data scientists, mobile, web and backend engineers to create custom tailored user flows through personalization. Our squad ensures customers realize value throughout their client journey. We deliver personalized experiences that help customers discover new and exciting features while getting the most out of their subscription.  

  

As a backend engineer, you will have the opportunity to have a significant impact on the company's growth and revenue by reaching new users, markets and audiences. We achieve this by truly understanding the needs of our users, and innovating and experimenting to solve real problems for them, building solutions across the entire client infrastructure to support our goal.  

  

**What You’ll Do**  

* Design, develop and deploy resilient and scalable Java services supporting web and mobile applications
* Work with other engineers on the team to adopt best practices and improve the quality of our solutions
* Collaborate with Data Scientists, Product Managers and Product Designers to build new product features
* Adopt a data-first mindset, producing high-quality data about user interactions and leveraging experimentation to measure the impact of new features
* Develop individually to continue to grow your impact and help mentor peers

  

**Who You Are**  

* You have 5+ years of working experience as a Backend Engineer working with Java. Additional tools and technologies such as gRPC, GCP, BigQuery and Bigtable are a plus.
* You have experience in implementing, and scaling cloud-native software components on providers such as GCP, AWS, etc.
* You have experience working directly with stakeholders to understand, document and develop APIs and systems to meet their requirements.
* You have written distributed, high-volume services and know how to deploy and keep them running in production.
* You have a growth mindset, are curious and not afraid to be experimental. You share your ideas and continuously improve yourself and the team around you.
* Experience with Conversion or User Retention is a plus
**Start Date:** 2025-07-14  

**End Date:** 2026-01-13

**Location:** Stockholm

title: Process Developer
description:
* **Job ID:** R0012103
* **Date posted:** 26/06/2025
**Company description*** **You see things a little differently. So do we!** At IKEA, we believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us.
* The role of IKEA Supply is to supply the IKEA range at the lowest total cost, making high quality available to the customer under good social and environmental conditions. Are you passionate about the IKEA business, culture and values and want to contribute to make beautiful homes available for the many? Then this opportunity might be for you.
 **Job description*** In Customs and Trade Compliance, we act as a strategic partner and trusted resource to create a culture of compliance and drive the continuous pursuit of operational excellence. Our mission is to enable an agile and compliant value chain through active customs and trade facilitation, to make the IKEA vision and strategies a living reality.
* We are now looking for a new colleague to join us in this exciting mission! The role as **Customs Process Developer** is responsible to support the development of ways of working, and identify continual process improvements taking into consideration processes, organization, solutions, software, and technology. This role has a global focus and will have a focus on and be assigned to customs classification processes that cover IKEA range products that include home furnishing and food, as well as IKEA Components. The role is required to continuously improve the end-to-end classification process in accordance with ISAG Customs and Trade Compliance roadmap and overall strategies, as well as in close collaboration with key stakeholders within the IKEA Range and Supply businesses to secure a proper and efficient classification of IKEA products and integration of classification master data and processes into overall end to end IKEA value chain.
* **Main responsibilities:**
* + Actively identify and propose process/sub process design and/or improvements and prepare basis for decisions. Control weaknesses and improvements must be analysed and included in benefits of proposed improvements.
	+ Proactively identify immediate, interim, and long term operational and/or technological resolutions to gain efficiencies and improve processes.
	+ Using your advanced technology skills and knowledge (i.e.: VBA, SQL, ACCESS, EXCEL, Power BI but not only) to combine and analyse data, develop functionality that secures compliance while improving workflow, processes and working routines.
	+ Lead, manage, and develop process improvement activities and projects, including the use of technology, IT tools and change management methodology to effect process improvements and workflow.
	+ Interact with key stakeholders, cross functionally and in forums in the development of processes and solutions.
	+ Secure interdependencies towards other connected processes.
	+ Develop, improve, and maintain process documentation in accordance with established framework (process maps, working methods, working instructions, task descriptions, measurement specifications, learning material …).
	+ Monitor process improvements and take necessary actions to secure expected performance and objectives.
	+ Participate in or lead projects and anchor changes through testing protocols and timelines and secure customs co-worker training to new ways of working.
	+ Actively support Trade Compliance and Customs teams with process improvements. Provide daily support where necessary.
	+ Participate in external networks for benchmarking and to enhance knowledge in relevant processes.
	+ Represent line organization in global projects and working groups to ensure global, regional and country customs and classification needs are considered. Ensure changes derived from projects and working groups are anchored within customs organizations and processes of assigned geographical location.
  

**Qualification**  
* + Two (2) or more years of experience in a process development environment
	+ Desire and ability to initiate and implement continuous improvement
	+ Strong knowledge and skills with the use of technology towards process improvements
	+ Change management, implementation, and process documentation skills
	+ Strong skills with the use of technology to improve processes in short-, mid- and long-term environments
	+ Strong analytical, investigative, and interpersonal skills with an attention to details, but in context of broader holistic processes and operations
	+ Proven ability to lead projects, and inspire people to develop the business together
	+ University degree or equivalent experience.
	+ High level of communication and negotiation skills.
	+ Fluent in English, both written and spoken and can easily communicate complex classification topics.
* Preferred experience
* + Previous experience or knowledge in working with or within supply chain operations.
	+ Experience within the import and export industry
	+ Experience with customs brokerage or customs compliance
  

**More Information*** Please note that we only accept applications in English and we **do not accept applications via email**. We look forward to receiving your application by **the 17th of July at the latest.**
* If you have any questions about the role, please reach out to Linda Rothfield, Deputy Customs and Trade Compliance Manager, Email: linda.rothfield@inter.ikea.com. For questions about the recruitment process, feel free to connect with Anna-Carin Nicolini, P&C Leader, Email: anna-carin.nicolini@inter.ikea.com.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer with Generative AI experience
description:
- **Tired of the same old code and solutions? Ready to dive into greenfield projects and sprinkle some Generative AI magic into your work?**

Devoteam Creative Tech in Gothenburg is on the hunt for a Senior Fullstack Developer who thrives on innovation, loves a good challenge, and has a knack for turning fresh ideas into tangible products. If you're passionate about building cutting-edge solutions and want the freedom to explore new tech, this is your stage!


**About Devoteam Creative Tech**

We're not just consultants; we're "Tech for People." Devoteam is an AI-driven tech consulting firm that's been guiding businesses through the tech landscape for 30 years. In our Creative Tech entity, we're all about crafting innovative, tailor-made solutions and fostering long-term partnerships. We believe in empowering our people, encouraging continuous learning, and fostering an environment where your ambition can truly flourish.


**Your Mission (Should You Choose to Accept It)**

As a Senior Fullstack Developer with us, you'll be a key player in working on exciting new projects with our clients. This isn't about maintaining legacy systems; it's about building from the ground up, with plenty of room to experiment and innovate. You'll primarily work at client offices in Gothenburg 2-3 days a week, collaborating closely with their teams and your Devoteam colleagues.


**You'll get to:**


	* Architect and develop robust backend solutions using .NET, ensuring scalability and top-notch performance.
	* Craft beautiful, responsive, and intuitive user interfaces with CSS and modern frontend frameworks like React.js.
	* Be hands-on with Azure, leveraging its powerful services to deploy and manage applications.
	* Dive into Generative AI projects, exploring new ways to integrate AI into products and solutions – this is where you get to truly innovate!
	* Ensure code quality and reliability through Cypress for end-to-end testing.
	* Work with messaging queues like Amazon SQS to build highly decoupled and resilient systems.
	* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, bringing fresh perspectives and solutions to the table.
	* Have the opportunity to work with brand-new codebases, fresh solutions, and exciting products that are just beginning their journey.**What Makes You Our Ideal Candidate?**


	* You're a Senior Developer with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software.
	* You have solid experience with .NET for backend development.
	* You're proficient in CSS and skilled in building engaging user experiences.
	* Hands-on experience with Azure is a must.
	* You're comfortable with Cypress for testing and ensuring robust applications.
	* Familiarity with messaging services, particularly Amazon SQS, is a big plus.
	* You've dipped your toes into Generative AI projects or have a burning desire to do so and apply it to real-world products.
	* You thrive in dynamic, client-facing environments and love the challenge of varied projects.
	* You're a natural problem-solver, innovative, and eager to explore new technologies.
	* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.**What we offer?**  

**Great location:** A nice office in the centre of Gothenburg


**Continuous learning:** We support continuous learning with biweekly knowledge-sharing groups, participation in Øredev and ongoing competence development days for your professional development. You have the opportunity to take a certificate with one of our partners (AWS, Azure, GCP) and have access to all Udemy courses.


**Leave and pension:** We offer 30 days of vacation, supplementary parental leave compensation and occupational pension according to ITP1.


**Health and well-being:** Obvious benefits such as wellness allowance, access to occupational health care, health checks and lunch-yoga in the office.


**Tools and equipment:** You choose the tools you need to deliver and thrive in your work environment.
  

  

**Coworkers:** Great, skilled coworkers who appreciate fun activities and techtalks.
  

  

If you're ready to devote your talent to a company that appreciates quality, fosters growth, and values its people, don't wait! Apply now and let's build something amazing together.
  

  

**Ps. We're currently enjoying our summer break, so things are a bit slow right now. We'll be reviewing applications like yours once we're back and fully refreshed.**

**We appreciate your patience and look forward to getting in touch soon!**
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Senior Backend Developer with Databricks & Snowflake Expertise
description:
- **Are you a seasoned Backend Developer passionate about transforming data into powerful solutions? Do you thrive in dynamic, client-facing roles, leveraging Databricks and Snowflake?**

Devoteam Creative Tech in Gothenburg is seeking a talented Senior Backend Developer to join our innovative consulting team. As an AI-driven tech consulting firm, we partner with leading clients, delivering impactful data and technology solutions. We're "Tech for People," fostering a culture of continuous learning and collaboration.  

  



**Your Role & Impact**

As a Senior Backend Developer, you'll design, develop, and implement robust, scalable backend solutions for our diverse clients, focusing heavily on Databricks and Snowflake. This is a consulting role, meaning you'll work closely with clients on-site (1-3 days/week in Gothenburg) and collaborate with Devoteam colleagues.


**You will:**


	* Develop high-performance backend services and APIs for data-intensive applications.
	* Architect and optimize data pipelines (ETL/ELT) using Databricks (Apache Spark, Delta Lake) and Snowflake (SQL, schema design, performance tuning).
	* Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and front-end developers on end-to-end solutions.
	* Provide technical leadership and mentorship.
	* Ensure best practices in code quality, testing, and security.**What We're Looking For:**


	* 5+ years experience as a Backend Developer or Data Engineer.
	* Proven hands-on expertise with both Databricks and Snowflake.
	
	
	
		+ Databricks: Strong with Apache Spark (PySpark/Scala) and Delta Lake.
		+ Snowflake: Expertise in SQL, data warehousing, and performance. Snowpark is a plus.
	* Solid backend development skills in Python (preferred), Scala, .Net/ C# or Java.
	* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
	* Strong understanding of data modeling and ETL/ELT methodologies.
	* Excellent problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.**What we offer?**  

**Great location:** A nice office in the centre of Gothenburg


**Continuous learning:** We support continuous learning with biweekly knowledge-sharing groups, participation in Øredev and ongoing competence development days for your professional development. You have the opportunity to take a certificate with one of our partners (AWS, Azure, GCP) and have access to all Udemy courses.


**Leave and pension:** We offer 30 days of vacation, supplementary parental leave compensation and occupational pension according to ITP1.


**Health and well-being:** Obvious benefits such as wellness allowance, access to occupational health care, health checks and lunch-yoga in the office.


**Tools and equipment:** You choose the tools you need to deliver and thrive in your work environment.
  

  

**Coworkers:** Great, skilled coworkers who appreciate fun activities and techtalks.
  

  

If you're ready to devote your talent to a company that appreciates quality, fosters growth, and values its people, don't wait! Apply now and let's build something amazing together.
  

  

**Ps. We're currently enjoying our summer break, so things are a bit slow right now. We'll be reviewing applications like yours once we're back and fully refreshed.**

**We appreciate your patience and look forward to getting in touch soon!**

title: Embedded Software Developer
description:
At Spring, we are building a virtual battery together with our customers. We are a diverse team of curious doers. Fortum Spring started as an internal start up inside Fortum, but as the business grew and became more mature, we are now an essential part of Fortum’s B2B offering. Our virtual battery enables flexible electricity consumption and storages to act together as one and support the increase of renewable energy. We have built multiple operational and growing business cases in the Nordics and are now scaling up and further aiming at a significant impact.


**About the role**



We are looking for a (senior) embedded software developer. Your main responsibility would be to develop our connectivity and communications solutions that are implemented at customers premises. You would be working as a part of a larger software development team, comprising of a product owner, a scrum master and several software developers. You would lead the embedded side of the development activities by contributing to writing the embedded software, but also defining the structure of the implementation and it’s relation to the rest of the system.

  



The position is permanent and located in Solna, Sweden. At the time the team is working in a hybrid mode and we have persons located in Finland, Sweden and Poland and while the primary location would be in Sweden, the role would include supporting customers through-out the Nordics.  


**What we are looking for**


* An ideal candidate would have deep technical understanding and experience in developing and implementing embedded software and understanding how it works as a part of a larger cloud based system
* Advanced understanding and working experience with following topics is required:
+ MQTT
+ Can-bus
+ Python
+ Modbus
+ Embedded systems based on Linux OS

* Working experience with Github and AWS + AWS IoT core
* Working experience with Jira and Confluence
* Understanding about SCRUM / Agile development frameworks
* Relevant educational background
* Full professional proficiency in English, Nordic languages considered as advantages, but working language in the team is English.

  



Additionally following skills / competences are considered as an advantage


* Understanding of the Nordic electricity market, especially ancillary services
* Understanding and experience on battery energy storage systems
* Experience on demand response
* Ability to work in a fast paced environment, where priorities can be shifted if needed

  


**We offer you**  


At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.  

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.  


**Interested?**

Submit your application latest on 30th of July. Please note that we will only be able to start processing the applications during August. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Ilari Alaperä, Ilari.Alapera@fortum.com, +358406885559.

Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of **this page****.**

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance.  

**We are Fortum**  


Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
company_description: Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe.

title: WAF-utvecklare
description:
* *Ansök senast: 13 juli 2025*
* *Stockholm*
***Arbetsuppgifter***
---------------------

*Är du teknikintresserad och har erfarenhet av webbsäkerhet och brandväggskonfiguration? Då kan det här vara en chans att få arbeta i ett litet team med stort ansvar i en miljö där säkerhet står i centrum.*

***Ditt team***  

*Du blir en del av ett litet och sammansvetsat team som idag består av tre säkerhetsspecialister. Vi behöver nu utöka teamet med ytterligare två specialister, där du kommer att arbeta tätt tillsammans inom teamet, driftorganisationen och andra teknikteam i banken. Vi arbetar agilt, är självgående i våra leveranser och är med och prioriterar vad vi ska fokusera på.*

*Vårt uppdrag är att säkra det digitala kundmötet. Vi äger, utvecklar och förvaltar lösningar som möjliggör säker identifiering och åtkomst för bankens kunder – avgörande komponenter i den digitala kundresan. Här är hög säkerhet, tillgänglighet och en sömlös användarupplevelse avgörande för att vi ska fortsätta förtjäna våra kunders förtroende att hantera deras tillgångar och data.*

***Din roll***  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en viktig roll i arbetet med att skydda bankens digitala tjänster genom att konfigurera och vidareutveckla vår Web Application Firewall (WAF). Ditt fokus ligger på att säkerställa ett robust skydd mot attacker genom att utforma, justera och underhålla säkerhetsregler och policies i applikationsbrandväggen.*

*Du kommer att arbeta nära andra teknikområden i banken och bidra med expertis vid felsökning, där analys av loggar och realtidstrafik är centralt. Vid akuta hot kan det innebära att snabbt blockera trafik, stänga ner funktioner tillfälligt eller genomföra kritiska justeringar för att täppa till sårbarheter.*

*Rollen är tekniknära och innebär ett stort ansvar för konfiguration, analys och kontinuerlig förbättring av våra skyddsmekanismer. Du får ett brett kontaktnät inom banken och blir en viktig del i arbetet med att utvärdera och implementera nya lösningar som stärker vår säkerhetsnivå ytterligare.*

***Vi har riktigt bra förmåner***
---------------------------------

* *Tjänstepension*
* *Vinstdelningssystem*
* *Gruppförsäkring*
* *Friskvårdsbidrag*
* *Bidrag vid föräldraledighet*
* *Banktjänster*
* *Banking services*
* *Benefit in connection with parental leave*
* *Health promotion subsidy*
* *Group insurance*
* *Occupational pension*
* *Profit-sharing scheme*
***Kvalifikationer***
---------------------

***Din profil***  

*Vi söker dig som har minst tre års erfarenhet inom nätverk och/eller IT-säkerhet, med ett särskilt intresse för webbsäkerhet. Du har god förståelse för vanliga attacker mot webbapplikationer, håller dig uppdaterad inom cybersäkerhetsområdet och har god kännedom om OWASP Top 10. Du har även erfarenhet av att arbeta med WAF-teknologier och kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.*  



***Meriterande erfarenheter:***

* *Tidigare arbete med F5 Networks produkter*
* *Erfarenhet av multi-cloudmiljöer*
* *Förståelse för OSI-modellen*
* *Kunskap inom AS3 (Application Services), iRules, lastbalansering, REST API:er och konfiguration av WAF-regler*
* *Förståelse för hur olika säkerhetslösningar samverkar samt kännedom om relevanta säkerhetskrav och regelverk*

***Personliga egenskaper:***

*Du arbetar strukturerat, följer etablerade processer och ser till att dina uppgifter slutförs med hög kvalitet. Du är samarbetsinriktad, stabil och trygg även i pressade situationer där snabba insatser krävs, exempelvis vid incidenthantering. Du har dessutom en god kommunikativ förmåga och kan på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt förklara tekniska lösningar och beslut, även för personer utanför ditt expertområde.*

***Välkommen med din ansökan!***

**Om företaget**
----------------

Hos oss får du ett stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka din egen och bankens framtida utveckling. Våra olika perspektiv, insikter och innovativa idéer utgör en grund för hur vi tillsammans bygger vidare banken för framtiden. För oss är utveckling allt och när du utvecklas, utvecklas banken.


Vi har ett unikt sätt att bedriva bank som bygger på en stark tilltro och respekt för den enskilda människan. Våra värderingar och starka företagskultur har en avgörande betydelse för vår framgång och guidar oss om hur vi uppnår våra mål, samarbetar och stöttar varandra. Genom stark lokal förankring, ett decentraliserat arbetssätt och ett långsiktigt perspektiv skapar vi hållbara relationer genom livets olika skeenden. Hos oss på Handelsbanken är alla viktiga. Vi kommer från olika platser med olika bakgrund, erfarenhet och utbildning. Tillsammans är vi Handelsbanken.

title: Systemutvecklare inom kravanalys i Östersund
description:
Placeringsort
Flera orter
Diarienummer
FK 2025/015906  



*Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan cirka 20 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 250 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför tänker vi nytt och använder den senaste tekniken för att förenkla och förbättra, utveckla och leverera it-tjänsterna för den svenska socialförsäkringen. Välkommen till en av Sveriges största it-avdelningar.***Kravanalys**
--------------



Som systemutvecklare kommer du att arbeta med utveckling av både frontend och backend i Java, där du deltar i hela processen från analys och design till implementation, testning och förvaltning. Du kommer även bidra till att skapa mjukvaruarkitektur för en skalbar infrastruktur med hjälp av OpenShift och Kubernetes.



Ett viktigt fokus är att säkerställa dagens omfattande utbetalningar och omvandla verksamhetsbehov till konkreta krav för it-systemen. För att möta dessa krav söker vi systemutvecklare med erfarenhet av kravanalys.



Som kravanalytiker hos oss är du länken mellan verksamheten och systemutvecklarna. I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår att identifiera och dokumentera bland annat aktörer, användningsfall, användargränssnitt, regler, begrepp, icke funktionella krav samt beroenden mot andra intressenter. Du skapar förståelse för kraven i teamet. Tillsammans och i nära samarbete med både product owner och scrum master ser du till att backloggen är uppdaterad och förberedd inför sprintplanering.



Vi arbetar i agila team med stort ansvarstagande och ett ständigt fokus på förbättring. Samarbete, kvalitet och en god användarupplevelse är centralt i vårt arbete. Vi värdesätter din vilja att utvecklas och bidra till att förbättra servicen för medborgarna.



Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.



Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar.



Vi söker dig som


* har högskoleexamen eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
* agerar på eget initiativ och tar ansvar för att nå goda resultat
* samarbetar effektivt med andra för att nå gemensamma mål
* har ett systematiskt och noggrant arbetssätt
* kan förstå och analysera komplexa frågor
* har god kommunikativ förmåga, i tal och skrift
* har goda kunskaper i svenska, i tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du har


* har erfarenhet som kravanalytiker
* har erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt
* har erfarenhet av DevOps
* har erfarenhet av ledarskap som teamledare
* har erfarenhet av Försäkringskassans förmåner.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.


**Övrigt**
----------



En tjänst, tillsvidare, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan bli aktuellt. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering. För den här tjänsten krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Möjlighet till distansarbete finns om arbetet tillåter. I den här rekryteringen kan arbetspsykologiska test användas som en del i urvalsarbetet. Placeringsorter: Sundsvall eller Östersund.



Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök fk.se/jobbahososs


**Kontaktpersoner**
-------------------



Chef: Stefan Bergsten, tel 010 118 71 96 eller Ewa Larsson-Snygg, tel 010 114 76 59 (för frågor om tjänsten). HR-specialist: Klas Lindblad 010 113 10 43 (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen). Fackliga representanter är för ST Anna-Lena Bahadori Lundgren, Saco-S Mohamed Abu-Torse, Seko Eliza Grundström. Dessa nås via vår växel 08-786 90 00.


**Ansökan**
-----------



Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 17 augusti 2025. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan.



Har du skyddade personuppgifter eller ingen tillgång till bank-id ringer du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.


Vi ska i allt vi gör, agera med utgångspunkt i principen om alla människors lika värde, rättssäkerhet och med god service till medborgarna.

title: Senior Backend Developer with Databricks & Snowflake Expertise
description:
**Company Description** **Are you a seasoned Backend Developer passionate about transforming data into powerful solutions? Do you thrive in dynamic, client-facing roles, leveraging Databricks and Snowflake?**


Devoteam Creative Tech in Gothenburg is seeking a talented Senior Backend Developer to join our innovative consulting team. As an AI-driven tech consulting firm, we partner with leading clients, delivering impactful data and technology solutions. We're "Tech for People," fostering a culture of continuous learning and collaboration.  



**Your Role & Impact**


As a Senior Backend Developer, you'll design, develop, and implement robust, scalable backend solutions for our diverse clients, focusing heavily on Databricks and Snowflake. This is a consulting role, meaning you'll work closely with clients on-site (1-3 days/week in Gothenburg) and collaborate with Devoteam colleagues.

**You will:**

* Develop high-performance backend services and APIs for data-intensive applications.
* Architect and optimize data pipelines (ETL/ELT) using Databricks (Apache Spark, Delta Lake) and Snowflake (SQL, schema design, performance tuning).
* Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and front-end developers on end-to-end solutions.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship.
* Ensure best practices in code quality, testing, and security.

**What We're Looking For:**

* 5+ years experience as a Backend Developer or Data Engineer.
* Proven hands-on expertise with both Databricks and Snowflake.


	+ Databricks: Strong with Apache Spark (PySpark/Scala) and Delta Lake.
	+ Snowflake: Expertise in SQL, data warehousing, and performance. Snowpark is a plus.
* Solid backend development skills in Python (preferred), Scala, .Net/ C# or Java.
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
* Strong understanding of data modeling and ETL/ELT methodologies.
* Excellent problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.

 **What we offer?**  

**Great location:** A nice office in the centre of Gothenburg

**Continuous learning:** We support continuous learning with biweekly knowledge-sharing groups, participation in Øredev and ongoing competence development days for your professional development. You have the opportunity to take a certificate with one of our partners (AWS, Azure, GCP) and have access to all Udemy courses.

**Leave and pension:** We offer 30 days of vacation, supplementary parental leave compensation and occupational pension according to ITP1.

**Health and well-being:** Obvious benefits such as wellness allowance, access to occupational health care, health checks and lunch-yoga in the office.

**Tools and equipment:** You choose the tools you need to deliver and thrive in your work environment.  

  

**Coworkers:** Great, skilled coworkers who appreciate fun activities and techtalks.  

  

If you're ready to devote your talent to a company that appreciates quality, fosters growth, and values its people, don't wait! Apply now and let's build something amazing together.  

  

**Ps. We're currently enjoying our summer break, so things are a bit slow right now. We'll be reviewing applications like yours once we're back and fully refreshed.**

**We appreciate your patience and look forward to getting in touch soon!**
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer with Generative AI experience
description:
**Company Description** **Tired of the same old code and solutions? Ready to dive into greenfield projects and sprinkle some Generative AI magic into your work?**


Devoteam Creative Tech in Gothenburg is on the hunt for a Senior Fullstack Developer who thrives on innovation, loves a good challenge, and has a knack for turning fresh ideas into tangible products. If you're passionate about building cutting-edge solutions and want the freedom to explore new tech, this is your stage!

**About Devoteam Creative Tech**


We're not just consultants; we're "Tech for People." Devoteam is an AI-driven tech consulting firm that's been guiding businesses through the tech landscape for 30 years. In our Creative Tech entity, we're all about crafting innovative, tailor-made solutions and fostering long-term partnerships. We believe in empowering our people, encouraging continuous learning, and fostering an environment where your ambition can truly flourish.

**Your Mission (Should You Choose to Accept It)**


As a Senior Fullstack Developer with us, you'll be a key player in working on exciting new projects with our clients. This isn't about maintaining legacy systems; it's about building from the ground up, with plenty of room to experiment and innovate. You'll primarily work at client offices in Gothenburg 2-3 days a week, collaborating closely with their teams and your Devoteam colleagues.

**You'll get to:**

* Architect and develop robust backend solutions using .NET, ensuring scalability and top-notch performance.
* Craft beautiful, responsive, and intuitive user interfaces with CSS and modern frontend frameworks like React.js.
* Be hands-on with Azure, leveraging its powerful services to deploy and manage applications.
* Dive into Generative AI projects, exploring new ways to integrate AI into products and solutions – this is where you get to truly innovate!
* Ensure code quality and reliability through Cypress for end-to-end testing.
* Work with messaging queues like Amazon SQS to build highly decoupled and resilient systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, bringing fresh perspectives and solutions to the table.
* Have the opportunity to work with brand-new codebases, fresh solutions, and exciting products that are just beginning their journey.

**What Makes You Our Ideal Candidate?**

* You're a Senior Developer with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software.
* You have solid experience with .NET for backend development.
* You're proficient in CSS and skilled in building engaging user experiences.
* Hands-on experience with Azure is a must.
* You're comfortable with Cypress for testing and ensuring robust applications.
* Familiarity with messaging services, particularly Amazon SQS, is a big plus.
* You've dipped your toes into Generative AI projects or have a burning desire to do so and apply it to real-world products.
* You thrive in dynamic, client-facing environments and love the challenge of varied projects.
* You're a natural problem-solver, innovative, and eager to explore new technologies.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.

 **What we offer?**  

**Great location:** A nice office in the centre of Gothenburg

**Continuous learning:** We support continuous learning with biweekly knowledge-sharing groups, participation in Øredev and ongoing competence development days for your professional development. You have the opportunity to take a certificate with one of our partners (AWS, Azure, GCP) and have access to all Udemy courses.

**Leave and pension:** We offer 30 days of vacation, supplementary parental leave compensation and occupational pension according to ITP1.

**Health and well-being:** Obvious benefits such as wellness allowance, access to occupational health care, health checks and lunch-yoga in the office.

**Tools and equipment:** You choose the tools you need to deliver and thrive in your work environment.  

  

**Coworkers:** Great, skilled coworkers who appreciate fun activities and techtalks.  

  

If you're ready to devote your talent to a company that appreciates quality, fosters growth, and values its people, don't wait! Apply now and let's build something amazing together.  

  

**Ps. We're currently enjoying our summer break, so things are a bit slow right now. We'll be reviewing applications like yours once we're back and fully refreshed.**

**We appreciate your patience and look forward to getting in touch soon!**

title: Software Application Developer Manager
description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

**Join Jeppesen, a Boeing Company: Empowering Aviation for Over 80 Years!**


For more than 80 years, Jeppesen has been dedicated to ensuring that pilots and their passengers reach their destinations safely and efficiently. As the world’s leading provider of aeronautical data and operational support, we blend our spirit of innovation with a rich legacy of aviation leadership to deliver cutting-edge navigation and optimization solutions for the 21st century.


Exciting Opportunity: **Software Application Developer Manager**


We are seeking a passionate and dynamic **Software Application Developer Manager** to join our Implementation department in Gothenburg, Sweden. This team is responsible for configuring and delivering our **Crew and Network management** products to airline customers, ensuring we meet their unique needs. This is a fantastic opportunity to lead and nurture a talented team of implementation specialists who tackle some of the most challenging optimization problems in the industry.


**What You’ll Do:**

* Lead and inspire a team of 7-15 individuals across 2-3 teams.
* Foster growth through coaching, mentoring, and constructive feedback.
* Oversee delivery goals, quality, and client relationships for selected implementations.
* Provide direction and support to your team in their work tasks.
* Be an integral part of our leadership team, driving continuous improvement.
* Contribute to the strategic goals of the department.
* Collaborate with various departments to expand our business.
* Engage in recruiting and onboarding to build and strengthen our team.


Location: Gothenburg, Sweden (with occasional travel to customers primarily within Europe, Africa, and the Middle East).

**Who You Are:**

* You have a passion for developing and empowering people.
* You possess experience in building, leading, and mentoring software development teams.
* You are dedicated to delivering exceptional value to customers.
* You bring enthusiasm and positivity to your work.
* You are a natural problem solver with a keen eye for structure.
* You embrace change and are always striving for improvement.
* You have a strong desire to learn and enhance ways of working.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* MSc or BSc or equivalent educational background.
* Experience in a people/line management position
* Experience with Airline Crew Management and Jeppesen Crew product customization.
* Strong communication skills, with fluency in additional languages being a plus.
* Familiarity with agile project methodologies, such as SAFe, and experience working within a scrum team.

**Required Competence:**

* Fluency in spoken and written English.

**Why Join Us?**

* Make a meaningful impact for airline clients around the globe.
* Be part of a significant, challenging, and rewarding mission.
* Work with the largest player in the aviation industry.
* Enjoy flexible working hours and a hybrid workplace.
* Access private medical care and subsidized gym and sports activities.
* Join our vibrant sports teams!


If you’re ready to make a difference and be part of something extraordinary, please submit your application in English.

**Relocation:** This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

**Visa Sponsorship:** Employer will initiate the visa application; however, the successful candidate will cover the cost of visa.

**Apply now and help shape the future of aviation with us at Boeing!**

  

Applications for this position will be accepted until **Aug. 01, 2025**

 **Export Control Requirements:** This is not an Export Control position. **Relocation**

Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position.

**Visa Sponsorship**

Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

**Shift**

Not a Shift Worker (Sweden)

 **Equal Opportunity Employer:**


We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.


We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world’s most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. We are proud members of the Valuable 500 and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process. Accommodations may include but are not limited to: conducting interviews in accessible locations that accommodate mobility needs, encouraging candidates to bring and use any existing assistive technology such as screen readers and offering flexible interview formats such as virtual or phone interviews.
company_description: Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company. We’re engineers & technicians. Innovators & dreamers. Join us, and build something better.

title: Lead Developer
description:
Welcome to apply to join our advanced API platform management teams, if software development is your passion then this is the perfect role for you. As a **Lead Developer** you will be able to shape the DevOps teams speed and quality of deliveries, these deliveries are used by a majority of software engineers and software deliveries as Telia company applies a API first policy.


**Is this your next opportunity?**

The APIgarden team is a distributed DevOps team delivering all core aspects of API management and is now growing to handle common API identity and access management and API security.


The Team works in a DevOps model with a constant improvement mindset and has seen tremendous growth in the usage of its deliveries.


APIgarden is part of API management in Telia Company Technology IT organization. API management department is lead by John Thorburn.


The role of Lead developer is to make sure the DevOps team delivers efficiently and with quality. The role will also be responsible for managing the access management and security features of the platform this will be done together with the teams Product owner.


The role grants you the power to


* Refine the software delivery process in the team (from requirement to deployment and all the way to decommissioning of features)

  

**Is this you?**

We also know you have the skill to pull the team you are working in together to make this delivery a possibility.


We know you have a passion for delivering high quality software products which are used by other developers to achieve their goals.


We know you are driven by a constant improvement mindset and understand that the improvements are delivered incrementally.


Your Experience:


* Working as a Lead Developer, Developer or DevOps engineer
* DevOps team member
* Agile methodologies Scrum, Kanban and SaFe
* Automated software delivery leveraging CI/CD
* Automated testing / quality assurance
* Cloud native application delivery
* Software project management tooling Jira, Confluence
* Github + Actions
* JFrog artifactory

**It’s more than just a job!**

  

Regardless of the position you are looking for, we will give you the tools and support you need to grow both as a professional and as a person, with us. We can offer you your next big opportunity in a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal access to opportunities. We respect and value the diversity of people. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility and offer a wide variety of employee benefits.


**Interested?** If you look forward to joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job you are welcome to contact me at john.thorburn@teliacompany.com , +46707670900 (send introduction SMS first please)

title: Systemutvecklare med Java och React-kompetens till SGU
description:
SGU är en myndighet som funnits sedan 1858. Trots dess ansenliga ålder är det en myndighet som använder avancerad teknik för att kartlägga våra geologiska resurser. För att tillgängliggöra vår kunskap och information för ökad samhällsnytta krävs IT-lösningar inom ett brett och spännande teknikområde. Allt för att presentera kvalitativa resultat till stöd för samhället, industrin och miljön.



Avdelningen IT och digitalisering består av ett 40-tal personer, experter inom allt från systemutveckling, IT-arkitektur, IT-säkerhet till drift och support. Vi behöver bli fler för att bygga och ta hand om våra framtida lösningar och därför söker vi nu en systemutvecklare med Java och React-kompetens.


**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------



Som systemutvecklare arbetar du i team. Teamet arbetar enligt agil metodik i nära dialog med beställare och andra specialister. Teamet ansvarar för utvecklingen av system och komponenter, med inslag av allt från kravanalys, UX, implementation, test, driftsättning och förvaltning.


**Kompetens**
-------------


**I denna rekryteringsprocess ska enbart CV bifogas och i din ansökan kommer du svara på urvalsfrågor kring kompetenserna nedan.**



Vi söker dig som har:


* en relevant universitets- och högskoleutbildning med inriktning mot IT, eller arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer är likvärdig
* aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av Java
* aktuell erfarenhet av React
* aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet och goda kunskaper i systemutveckling inom följande:
* IntelliJ IDEA, GitLab
* Maven, Spring, Spring Boot
* JavaScript, TypeScript, Html, Sass, Bootstrap
* Tillgänglighetsanpassning – WCAG 2.1
* SQL Server, PostgreSQL
* Docker Desktop, Rancher
* Testning av frontend och backend (manuellt och automatiskt)
* aktuell erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt
* god förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska


Meriterande erfarenheter och kompetens:


* iOS


Du kommer även att kortfattat beskriva dina kunskaper och erfarenheter inom dessa områden:


* Back-end
* Front-end
* Agila arbetssätt

**Personliga kvalifikationer**
------------------------------



För denna tjänst är det viktigt att du har en god samarbetsförmåga, där du kan arbeta bra med ditt team och andra interna och externa parter. Vi ser att du är lyhörd, kommunikativ på ett tydligt sätt och har lätt för att se möjligheter i förändringar och ändrade omständigheter. Du ska kunna ta egna initiativ, strukturera och prioritera dina arbetsuppgifter för att kunna driva arbetet framåt på ett effektivt sätt, både för dig själv och teamet. Vi ser gärna att du trivs med ett mer mål- och resultattänk i din planering, dina prioriteringar och ditt agerande, likaväl som du har förmågan att, utifrån verksamhetens behov, se helheten och agera utifrån ett större perspektiv.


**Om anställningen**
--------------------



Anställningsform: Särskild visstidsanställning på heltid med tillträde omgående eller enligt överenskommelse och som pågår fram till 30 juni 2026.



Antal lediga tjänster: 1



Anställningsort: Uppsala


**Ansökan**
-----------



Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 17 juli 2025. Intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden. Dina meriter ska kunna styrkas genom uppvisande av originalhandlingar eller styrkt meritförteckning. Vi tillämpar ett inkluderande synsätt och eftersträvar mångfald ur alla aspekter. Som statlig myndighet omfattas SGU av offentlighetsprincipen. Det innebär att vi är skyldiga att lämna ut dina ansökningshandlingar om någon efterfrågar dem. SGU använder ett webbaserat rekryteringssystem som du ansöker genom via vår webbplats.



Vill du veta mer, hör av dig till enhetschef Marina Becher eller våra fackliga företrädare: Peter Åkerhammar för Saco-S och Annika Törnkvist för ST-geologiska via vår växel 018-17 90 00.



Rekryteringen utför SGU i egen regi och vi undanber oss därmed telefonsamtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonsförsäljare.


**Diarienummer: 411-1493/2025**

title: Utvecklare
description:
Som utvecklare hos oss är du med och bygger IT-system och lösningar som är en del av grunden för ett fungerande samhälle. Vi söker dig som vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Vi skapar möjligheter och förutsättningar – resten är upp till dig. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!  

  

**Om jobbet**  

Som utvecklare ingår du i ett av våra agila utvecklingsteam från dag ett. I nära samverkan med verksamheten levererar teamen färdiga lösningar som förenklar för miljontals privatpersoner och företag. Våra system bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle genom att skapa förutsättningar för bland annat beskattning, folkbokföring, demokratiska val, brottsbekämpning och internationella samarbeten.


Du har varierande arbetsuppgifter i en modern utvecklingsmiljö som bland annat omfattar Red Hat OpenShift (OCP), Linux, Kubernetes, Docker, Java, Spring Boot, React, Angular, TypeScript, JavaScript, MuleSoft, ActiveMQ, Kafka, GIT, Gradle och Jenkins samt inom webbområdet även SiteVision.


När du börjar blir du väl omhändertagen och får en introduktion som är anpassad för dig. Du har kollegor med mycket erfarenhet, som tar sig tid att svara på frågor och som du lär dig av. Vi är en stor it-organisation med över 1500 kollegor där du har möjlighet att hela tiden växa och få ny kunskap genom kontinuerlig vidareutveckling. Arbetsmiljön är välkomnande och prestigelös och vi bryr oss om våra medarbetare. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.


Skatteverkets IT-avdelning arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande arbetsplats som präglas av jämställdhet och mångfald där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas. Läs mer på Jobba med IT hos oss.


Du tillhör Kontrolluppgiftssektionen på enhet ITPB på IT-avdelningen, med placering i Västerås. På  

orten är vi 85 kollegor.  

  

**Om dig**  

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.


I det här jobbet ska du:

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


Du ska även ha:

* en avslutad relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom exempelvis datavetenskap, matematik eller fysik om minst 300 högskolepoäng
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet inom Linux
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att skriva bash-script
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av programmering i Java och Python.


Det är önskvärt att du har relevant och aktuell erfarenhet inom Springboot, Git och maskininlärning

**Bra att veta**  

Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med provanställning i sex månader.


En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.


På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.


När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.


Välkommen med din ansökan!


Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Västerås | Län: Västmanlands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/569 | Kontakt: Karl-Adam Bredwad 010-5742057, Therese Schönbeck 010-5734714, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-06-26 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-07-02

title: Software Developer for Packet Core
description:
Göteborg,Västra Götaland,Sweden
Job ID**768672**
Join our Team
**About this opportunity:**


Here is an opportunity to work with cutting edge technology as we develop ground-breaking best-in-class telecom technology. We do research and development that includes AI, cloud and containerization as we continue the roll-out of 5G and look ahead towards 6G with the smartest and most advanced systems on the market. We achieve this through an innovative and agile environment, with e.g. tech-days, hackathons and every-day-innovation-time as we believe that our edge comes from our awesome engineers.  

  

**About us:**

  

We work in an agile environment, using methods and principles like Kanban and Scrum. Early customer and stakeholder feedback are key elements in our development process which is based on Continuous Integration practices and a strong and personal relation with the Product Owners. We believe on team autonomy and responsibility to finish the tasks according to a prioritized backlog in this high-trust environment.


We are now looking for an awesome C++ developer to join one of our agile and cross functional teams, working with High Availability and Networking feature development within the Session Control Plane of Packet Core, at our beautiful water-front office in Lindholmen, Gothenburg, Sweden.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Design, implement and test the feature, product and system from requirements for production and commercial deployment in collaboration with your team and Product Owner, as we believe in a ‘team first’ approach
* Work with high availability (Geo-redundancy, Session Resilience) and networking (Cloud networking, Container networking, Private/Public Clouds, TCP/IP, HTTP)
* Be a part of a cross-functional, self-organizing and highly independent team
* Use CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery) flow and philosophy, with pipelines developed for as-a-Service, with fast feedback loops

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* MSc/BSc level in Computer Science with communication and/or network focus - Strong interest in and ability to do software development
* 1-3 years of experience from working with large backend software systems
* Comfortable working with large and complex codebases (preferably in C++)
* Knowledge in cloud technologies and tools, container/microservices
* Passion and love to continue developing your knowledge
* Curiosity to understand customer needs and how to address them
* Interest in understanding the whole product and its environment
* Open mindset, asking for help, sharing knowledge and a team-first approach
* Effortless communication in English, written and spoken

 ***Here are some technologies we use and experience with these are seen as meritorious;*** Modern C++, Python, Kubernetes, Codeium, TDD, Scrum, Gerrit / Git, Telecom (Packet Core).

 **Characteristics we hope to see in you**


We are excited to welcome someone who loves working together, sharing ideas, and learning from others. If you are curious about new technology and enjoy connecting with teammates and people across the organization, you’ll fit right in with us! We value open communication and knowledge sharing, and we believe everyone has something unique to contribute. Your passion for helping others and finding creative solutions will make a real difference here. We can’t wait to see the new ideas and fresh perspectives you’ll bring to our team!  

  

***Last Application: 11/7-2025***  

***We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail***

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

title: Junior SW Developer
description:
Karlskrona,Blekinge,Sweden
Job ID**769258**
Join our Team
**About this opportunity:**


Are you ready to launch your career in software development and play a key role in shaping the future of technology?  

We are building a brand-new unit of Junior Software Developers in Karlskrona, and this is a unique opportunity to join from the ground up.  

As part of this freshly formed, dynamic team, you will get the opportunity to work on variety of exciting and challenging assignments.  

You’ll gain hands-on experience at the forefront of large-scale software development within a high-performing, multicultural environment.  

Join us and be part of something truly special—help us create the foundation for a thriving team that will drive innovation and growth.

 **Who are we?**


At Ericsson, our vision is to create a world where limitless connectivity enhances lives, transforms businesses, and leads the way to a sustainable future. Our office is located in the charming world heritage town of Karlskrona, nestled in a stunning archipelago.  

Join us and seize the opportunity to collaborate with passionate developers who are at the forefront of cutting-edge technologies. We foster a strong culture of knowledge sharing and ensure that work is always enjoyable. Experience the global environment as we closely collaborate and cooperate with colleagues across various Ericsson locations.

 **What will you do?**


You will drive your career and development growth through various assignments within the Karlskrona R&D Center's strategic competence domains (Cloud Native, Fintech, AI Native, DevOps, Security and Autonomous Network). Your role will encompass a wide range of development activities aimed at enhancing and refining your software craftsmanship. The exact scope of your assignments will be determined between you and us, allowing flexibility to adapt to both your strengths and the organization’s evolving needs.

 **To be successful in the role we believe you need:**

* A spirit of positiveness and creativeness with a can-do-attitude
* The skills to be ready to explore new opportunities as well as continuously learn and improve together with the team and really enjoy coding
* The social skills to cooperate closely in a diverse team of colleagues
* MSc or BSc level in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Security, IT or equivalent level of knowledge
* Software engineering skills with ability to write qualitative code in languages such as Java or similar. It is meriting if you know frontend technologies.
* Knowledge in development environments and tools like Git, Gerrit, Maven, Jenkins etc.
* Knowledge in containerization & cloud technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.
* Have an AI first mindset to utilize the potential of AI in software development
* Leaderships skills in the sense of being brave enough to take responsibility for your area of tasks and personal development, and in the long run also for the team or complete product.
* Previous experience from Ericsson is a merit.
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**
