 To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
   

  

 For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
   

  

**A few examples of your responsibilities** 
* Help shape outstanding user experiences and impact the success of our products by creating flawless UI and UX designs, from conceptualization to delivery. You’ll take a human-first approach to designing products, ensuring they delight users by being as effective as they are aesthetically pleasing.
* Make use of prototyping tools to ensure your designs are intuitive and to explore new, innovative ways of designing interactions.
* Work closely with product managers and software engineers to propose new features and improve the quality of both mobile and desktop apps.
* Focus on user testing and research to ensure our customers are always at the core of our product designs.
* Find, together with engineers, the most efficient trade-off between high-value solutions for users and the complexity of implementation.
* Leverage usage data to evaluate the impact of your designs, and apply your learnings to the next iterations.


**What we look for** 
* **Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
* **Drive.** 
 You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
* **Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
* **Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


**What we offer** 
* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: Digital Designer
description:
**Vi söker** 




 Är du en kreativ stjärna med ett öga för säljande idéer i digitala kanaler? Har du erfarenhet av att skapa kampanjer som engagerar och konverterar och vill vara en del av ett starkt inhouseteam med ett meningsfullt syfte? Då kan det vara dig vi söker!
 



  





  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 Som Digital Creative hos
 **Svenska Postkodlotterie** 
 t är du en viktig kugge i att ta fram säljande och målgruppsanpassade kampanjer i digitala kanaler. Du arbetar nära kollegor i det kreativa teamet och ansvarar för att utveckla innehåll som engagerar, konverterar och stärker varumärket. Du är kreativ inom ramarna för ett större kampanjkoncept och förstår hur du anpassar idéer till olika kanaler som Instagram, YouTube, TikTok och banners
 



  





 Vi söker dig som är både idéstark och hands-on, som gillar att jobba nära affären och kan förklara dina idéer på ett övertygande sätt.
 



  





**Din profil** 




  





 Vi söker dig som:
 


* Har minst fem års erfarenhet som Art Director eller Digital Creative, gärna från en inhousebyrå som arbetat med prenumerationstjänster eller kommersiella varumärken.



  




* Är van att arbeta med Performance Marketing och vet hur man optimerar kreativt innehåll för att skapa konvertering.



  




* Har god känsla för design och stark förståelse för olika digitala format, från rörligt innehåll till sociala medier och banners.



  




* Kan självständigt skapa kampanjer utifrån ett befintligt koncept, anpassa dem till rätt kanal och målgrupp och gärna ta idéer vidare tillsammans med teamet.



  




* Är trygg i att ta och ge konstruktiv feedback och har erfarenhet av att presentera idéer internt.



  




* Har goda kunskaper i Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere, After Effects). Du behöver inte vara en teknisk specialist, men du är bekväm med verktygen.



  




* Har goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.



  





**Meriterande om du har** 



* Erfarenhet av Figma eller andra designprogram.
* Arbetat i Bannerflow, AdLayer eller Smartly.
* Fotovana och erfarenhet av retusch.
* Relevant utbildning från Berghs, Beckmans eller motsvarande.



  





 Som person är du strukturerad och organiserad. Du trivs med att driva flera projekt parallellt utan att tappa helhetsbilden. Du är en prestigelös lagspelare som gillar att samarbeta och du håller dig naturligt uppdaterad på vad som händer inom digital design, trender och nya format. Du är nyfiken, proaktiv och brinner för kommunikation och kreation som gör skillnad.
 



  





**Om företaget** 




 Vi är Sveriges största lotteri där alla som deltar bidrar till välgörenhet och samtidigt har chans att vinna tillsammans med sina grannar. Övertygelsen om att världen blir bättre med starka ideella organisationer är grunden till att Postkodlotteriet startades. Idag finns vi i Nederländerna, Storbritannien, Tyskland, Norge och Sverige. Sedan starten 2005 har Svenska Postkodlotteriets lottköpare bidragit med 16,5 miljarder kronor till ideell sektor. Pengar som har gjort skillnad i Sverige och i världen.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Uppdraget är en visstidsanställning om sex månader på heltid, med möjlighet till förlängning. Tjänsten är placerad på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Visst låter det som en spännande roll? Sök gärna tjänsten idag. Vi intervjuar kandidater under juni och augusti.

title: Freelance Copywriter,  Part-Time | Immediate Start – July & August
description:
**About Us**
 At Twigeo, we’re on a mission to craft innovative and impactful digital marketing campaigns. With a growth-driven mindset, we thrive at the intersection of creativity and strategy, delivering measurable results while pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 We’re looking for a Copywriter who can start immediately to support one of our clients on a part-time, freelance basis. The initial workload is approximately 20 hours in July, with an increase of approximately 115h in August. While this role begins as a short-term contract, there is a possibility for extension into a one-year, full-time freelance contract.
   

  

 As a Copywriter at Twigeo, you’ll craft compelling messaging and creative concepts across multiple brands, ensuring communication that resonates with target audiences and drives results. Some days, you’ll be writing sharp, in-platform copy for Growth Marketers to use in performance ads; other times, you’ll be shaping the narrative for UGC content, developing engaging storytelling ads, or refining a brand’s voice across multiple touchpoints. You’ll play a key role in our global creative team, pushing the boundaries of brand voice, storytelling, and persuasive communication to deliver high-performing campaigns that drive real results.
   

  

**Expectations of a Copywriter at Twigeo**
 As we work primarily with US clients you need to be more than fluent in English, you are native. You are a creative and strategic thinker with a passion for storytelling and brand communication. Whether crafting compelling headlines, engaging brand messaging, writing captions for social, or refining a brand’s tone, you have a deep understanding of how words shape perception and drive action.
   

  

 As a copywriter, you create compelling ideas and clear stories rooted in client goals and audience insights. You make sure messaging is consistent across all channels, working closely with creatives and strategists. You know how to turn complex ideas into simple, persuasive copy while keeping the brand voice sharp and adapting for different platforms. You’re proactive, collaborative, and confident in presenting and explaining your work, always balancing creativity with strategic thinking.
   

  

 You’re a curious copywriter. You don’t fear AI, you use it. As a tool, it helps you test faster, explore angles, and sharpen ideas. It's not about replacing your voice – it’s about making it more effective.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* 3+ years of experience in copywriting, brand messaging, or content creation within a creative agency, digital marketing team, or similar environment.
* Experience in writing UX and product copy, including onboarding flows, tooltips, CTAs, and error messages.
* Proven ability to develop compelling, clear, and strategic messaging across formats like headlines, scripts, campaign copy, social media, and in-platform performance ads.
* Comfortable optimizing copy across app stores and running A/B tests to improve performance.
* Proficiency with tools like Google Workspace, ChatGPT, and similar platforms.
* Ability to review and improve CRM copy in the clients sign-up flow.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in both Swedish and English.


**How You Work**
* You’re a creative thinker with passion for storytelling, brand voice, and audience engagement strategies across different platforms - especially social media.
* You’re collaborative — working closely with creatives, strategists, and marketers comes naturally.
* You’re process-driven and organized, using tools like Google Sheets to manage feedback and versioning.
* You’re able to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adapt your writing style to fit different tones, platforms, and audiences.
* You love turning insights into strong creative concepts — using words as your most powerful tool.


**Why Join Twigeo?**
* Collaborate with other creatives to bring ideas to life.
* Be a part of a growth agency on a journey to expand its creative offering.
* Work with a dynamic team passionate about innovation and measurable impact.
* Collaborate on campaigns for diverse clients, combining strategy and creativity.


**What We Offer**
* Comprehensive Health Benefits: Access our health benefit program designed to support your well-being.
* Flexible Work Environment: Thrive in a flexible setup that supports remote work, with in-office or client-site presence only when needed for collaboration or project requirements.
* Growth Opportunities: Advance your career in a dynamic environment that encourages skill development and innovation.
* Recognition and Impact: Join a workplace where your ideas are valued, your voice is heard, and your contributions make a difference.


**Salary:** 
 1 000 SEK/hour
   

  

**Apply Now**
 Ready to take the next step in your career? Join us in shaping the future of marketing.
   

  

 Within the Creative Team, we work from the office multiple times per week. Please have that in mind before you submit your application.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**At Grade, we're building better workplaces by helping people find the right jobs and helping companies hire and grow smarter. As a fast-growing HR tech company with deep roots across the Nordics, we’re on a mission to build a strong, unified brand—and we’re looking for a
 *creative powerhouse* 
 to lead that charge.** 




  





**We’re not looking for someone to just “make things pretty.” We need a strategic design partner—someone with vision, craft, and the ambition to push boundaries.** 




  





**What you’ll do** 




 As our sole in-house visual designer, you will:
 


* **Own, evolve, and enforce** 
 the visual identity of all Grade brands, balancing creativity with consistency.
* **Be the brand champion** 
 —ensuring every design aligns with our guidelines and upholds a coherent, recognizable look and feel across channels.
* **Design a wide variety of materials** 
 , including:
* Social media assets, digital ads, and web visuals
* Sales decks, pitch presentations, and internal communications
* Event materials, trade show booths, and employer branding
* Campaigns and marketing collateral
* Web design (WordPress & Elementor)
* **Collaborate closely with marketing managers** 
 to turn ideas and strategies into compelling visual assets.
* **Bring a critical eye to the table** 
 —don’t just follow briefs; refine, challenge, and elevate them.
* **Act as “brand police” when needed** 
 —confidently guiding others toward design consistency and brand integrity.
* **Leverage AI-powered tools** 
 to boost efficiency, experiment, and scale creative output.



  





**What we’re looking for** 



* 5+ years of experience and a strong portfolio of branding and marketing design.
* A hybrid mindset—you value classic design principles but embrace new formats, tools, and platforms.
* Proficiency with Figma, Canva, WordPress (Elementor), Adobe Creative Suite, and comfort with both digital and print.
* Fluency in AI-based design tools (image/video generation) and the ability to prompt effectively in line with our brand voice.
* Ability to juggle multiple projects with speed and precision—no bottlenecks here.



  





 Grade is undergoing an exciting transformation—from a house of brands to a cohesive
 **master brand** 
 . You’ll be the creative lead behind that evolution. This is your chance to
 **build a recognizable, standout visual identity** 
 that ties everything together.
 



  





**You’ll love this role if you...** 



* Want
 **end-to-end creative ownership**
* Crave variety and impact
* Believe in brand as a business driver
* Think design is about
 **strategy as much as aesthetics**



  





**Why Join Grade?** 




 We’re a fast-growing group of companies under the Grade brand, backed by Viking Growth. With 200+ employees across the Nordics, we offer a full suite of talent solutions - from recruitment to development.
 



  





 At Grade, you’ll find a warm, inclusive culture with high ambitions and a strong team spirit. We value your growth, well-being, and work-life balance.
 



  





**What We Offer** 



* Flexible hours & remote work options
* 6 weeks' vacation
* Wellness allowance (SEK 5,000/year + 1 hour/week for exercise)
* ITP1 pension, salary exchange, and parental pay
* Great onboarding and career development opportunities



  





**How We Hire** 




 No cover letter needed - just your CV and answers to a few short questions. We review applications continuously, so don’t wait to apply!

title: Graphic Designer
description:
We’re Valtech RADON, an award-winning hybrid creative agency – part of the Valtech family. If you are interested in joining our team, you are welcome to apply with your resume.
 



  





 At Valtech RADON, we combine creative, strategy, craft, and media with Valtech's business transformation skills to build remarkable brands across all touchpoints. We work with some of the world’s most recognisable brands – including Pantene, Ericsson, Husqvarna, Head&Shoulders, and Nordic brands like RFSU, Halebop and Byggmax.
 



  





 We’re the second home to 50+ people spanning 10+ nationalities (and many more backgrounds, experiences, and places we've called home). Our office is in Stockholm, Sweden, but we work with brands worldwide and welcome applicants from all over the world.
 



  





**The role** 




 We’re seeking a talented designer who seamlessly blends traditional graphic design skills with prompt engineering for AI tools. You're well-versed in AI platforms like Midjourney, Adobe Firefly, and Figma AI, and maintain proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite.
 



  





 You likely have a foundation in traditional graphic design but are deeply engaged with the industry's rapid evolution. Your keen eye for design and creative mindset enable you to craft effective prompts, iterating them to perfection. AI is an integral part of your workflow, serving both as an idea generator and a production partner.
 



  





 In this entry-to-mid-level role, you'll be a vital member of our creative department. You'll push technological boundaries while collaborating with designers and creatives specialising in advertising, PR, and film.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 



* Create a variety of work for campaigns and brands.
* Collaborate closely with other designers, motion designers, film directors, and the rest of the creative team
* Work with design presentations for various pitches.
* Be part of building, challenging, and expanding our brand within the field of design.



  





**Who you are** 




 To be considered for this role, you must meet the following essential qualifications:
 



  




* Have a solid portfolio of projects and at least 2 years of experience.
* A hybrid creative. You understand and are comfortable in the traditional advertising channels, but don’t limit your creativity to that expression. You’re embracing new technology and are eager to take brand creativity to places and spaces it hasn’t been before.
* Experienced using AI image and video generation tools
* The ability to refine prompts to align with brand ideas, tone, and style
* Hungry. We’re looking for someone with the ambition to be a part of making V\_RADON a top agency globally
* Split vision. You can work on several projects at the same time.
* Thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Great work ethic and holds no prestige.



  





**The opportunity** 




 At Valtech RADON, you can apply your creativity and AI expertise on global assignments for some of the world’s most recognisable brands. And by working closely with ambitious creatives from all parts of the industry, it’s a place to grow as an individual and a creative.
 



  





 Being part of the larger Valtech organisation, you’ll find an environment designed for continuous learning, meaningful impact, and professional growth. Whether you're pioneering new digital solutions, challenging conventional thinking or building the next generation of customer experiences, your work will help transform industries.
 



  





 Read more about us at https://valtechradon.com/
 



  





**We are looking forward to your application!** 




  





**Last application date 2025-08-03** 
 , interviews will be held continuously and the position can be closer earlier.
 



  





**About Valtech RADON** 




 Valtech RADON is an award-winning hybrid creative agency working with some of the world’s strongest brands – including Pantene, Carlsberg and Electrolux. House of Radon was founded in 2006. In 2021, we joined forces with Valtech under the new name Valtech RADON. We’re the second home to 50+ people spanning 10+ nationalities (and many more backgrounds, experiences, and places we've called home). Our office is in Stockholm, Sweden, but we work with brands all over the world.

title: Product Owner
description:
Do you have a passion for delivering exceptional products and a keen eye for quality? We are looking for a Senior Product Owner who thrives on turning customer needs into polished, high-performing solutions. If you are detail-oriented, collaborative, and dedicated to excellence, we would love to have you on our team!
   

  

 The team that you would be joining at DeLaval is dedicated to creating innovative online services that monitor and maintain equipment, such as IoT devices, used in modern farming. By leveraging cutting-edge technology, we provide real-time insights into the performance of farming equipment, helping our customers optimize efficiency and ensure the well-being of their animals. Our cross-functional teams work collaboratively to design, develop, and maintain these services, ensuring that they meet the highest standards of reliability, ease of use, and value for our global customer base. Through these services, we enable farmers to make data-driven decisions and enhance their productivity.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Include**
* Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with development, design, and project management teams to ensure the product meets both user needs and business goals. Empower the team to make technical decisions, while offering guidance on product priorities and objectives.
* Backlog Ownership and Prioritization: Own and prioritize the product backlog, ensuring that features and enhancements are aligned with business value and customer needs. Collaborate with the team to refine and break down requirements into actionable user stories.
* Empower Technical Decision-Making: Foster an environment where developers take technical ownership and make decisions on how to implement product features. Provide the context and goals but trust the team to find the best solutions based on their expertise.
* Requirements Definition and Storytelling: Work with stakeholders and project managers to gather insights, define clear product requirements, and document user stories that are easily understandable and actionable by the development team.
* Decision-Making and Trade-offs: Make data-informed decisions about product features, releases, and priorities, while considering technical feasibility and resource constraints. Balance short-term and long-term goals to maximize impact.
* Stakeholder Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for product-related communication, managing expectations and ensuring stakeholders are informed about progress, timelines, and changes.
* Foster Team Autonomy: Promote a culture of trust and accountability within the team, where developers are empowered to make the right technical decisions, ensuring they feel supported and aligned with the product's vision.
* Iterative Improvement: Gather feedback, analyze user data, and collaborate with the team to continuously improve the product, delivering incremental value and evolving based on real-world insights.
* Visualize and Communicate Progress: Continuously communicate product progress to project managers and key stakeholders. Provide clear and consistent updates using dashboards, reports, and status meetings to ensure alignment, visibility, and transparency on timelines, risks, and achievements. Proactively addressing any blockers or risks, and ensuring the team remains focused on delivering high-quality, valuable features.
* Validate Features: Validate features developed by the team to ensure they meet the defined product requirements and user needs. This includes reviewing completed features, conducting acceptance testing, and collaborating with QA to ensure the highest quality standards. Provide feedback to ensure the delivered features align with the product vision and meet business goals.


**Required Experience And Skills**
* Proven experience as a Product Owner or in a similar role, with a strong focus on delivering customer-centric products in an agile environment.
* Experience with backlog management, prioritization, and working closely with development teams to ensure features are delivered efficiently.
* Ability to empower and trust development teams with technical decision-making, while providing clear context and direction on product goals and priorities.
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively across teams, balancing product goals with technical constraints, and ensuring alignment between business and technical stakeholders.
* Experience working in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban) with a focus on continuous delivery and iterative improvement.
* Strong communication skills, including the ability to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Critical thinking and problem-solving skills, with a knack for balancing short-term tactical needs with long-term strategic goals.
* Ability to make decisions based on data and feedback, and adjust priorities as needed to maximize product impact.
* Passion for creating great products and working in a collaborative, autonomous team culture.
* Experience working in distributed or remote teams.
* Attention to Detail in Validation: Strong attention to detail to review and validate features post-development to ensure they meet the required standards and fulfill the business needs.


**Bonus Skills (optional)**
* Familiarity with UX/UI design principles and experience collaborating with design teams to enhance the user experience.
* Knowledge of data analytics and using data to inform product decisions.
* Experience in technical product management or working closely with engineering teams on complex product features.
* Understanding of cloud technologies and modern software architectures.


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behavior. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviors: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* A secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance, parental leave, reduction of working hours).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year.
* Private health insurance.
* Flexible working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely; however, employees are expected to be in the office at least three days per week.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us. During the holiday period, it may take some time before you hear from us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Janusz Frankowski, janusz.frankowski@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Webbutvecklare
description:
**Ska-krav:**
* Minst 4 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att utveckla och designa hemsidor i WordPress.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att skapa användarvänliga och tillgänglighetsanpassade


 webbplatser, inklusive arbete med design, struktur och navigering.
   

  

* Kunskap om UX/UI-design.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera och strukturera innehåll, inklusive nyhetsflöden, kalendarium, publicering av artiklar och rapporter.
* Grundläggande kunskap om SEO.
* Erfarenhet att arbeta med integrationer och anpassningar av WordPress-plugins och teman.
* god förmåga att uttrycka sig både muntligt och skriftligt på svenska


**Var god förklara hur du uppfyller alla kraven.**
**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Ort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Period** 
 : 04-08-2025-04-10-2025
   

  

**Sista ansökningdag: 06-07-2025**
*Vi presenterar löpande. Om du är intresserad av ett uppdrag rekommenderar vi att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.*

title: Senior Learning Consultant, Sales & Commercial Enablement (Europe and APAC Regions)
description:
Senior Learning Consultant, Sales & Commercial Enablement (Europe and APAC)
   

  

 A Senior Learning Consultant, Sales & Commercial Enablement (Commercial Academy) at DLL is a member of the global L&D Leadership Team and specializes in the design and delivery of effective learning programs, sales training and enablement – building sustainable and impactful sales capabilities and skills across our commercial organizations.
   

  

 In partnership with DLL’s Commercial Effectiveness and Transformation team, this role will be regionally aligned to the Europe and APAC regions but with a global impact on our commercial organization. Responsible for leading both strategy development and execution in the aligned region with the goal of enabling our commercial members to be more effective, efficient, and successful.
   

  

 Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL
   

  

**Day To Day**
* Program management: Oversee the end-to-end process of commercial learning programs – from design, development, delivery, evaluation and impact.
* Needs assessment: Identify and prioritize commercial capabilities and skills and determine learning needs, including user research.
* Sustainable and scalable learning architecture design: Design personalized, sustainable and scalable commercial learning architecture and solutions, which includes a blend of learning experiences, learning journeys, coaching and resources.
* Digital tools and AI: Leverage digital tools, including AI, to enhance the overall learning experience.
* Learning journeys: Develop and implement capability-based learning journeys to support DLL commercial member development and career advancement.
* Facilitate learning and deliver training: Lead engaging and participatory learning sessions to ensure participants can experience and practice new capabilities and skills.
* Lead Network/Community of Facilitators: develop and coach a network of facilitators in the commercial organization who can develop, deliver, and evaluate commercial learning programs.
* Evaluate effectiveness and impact: Using global L&D evaluation framework, measure the effectiveness and impact of learning programs through feedback, performance metrics and assessments.
* Collaborate with stakeholders and vendors: Work with DLL members and external training providers to design and deliver leadership development programs.
* Stay up to date: Research and learn about trends and best practices in sales enablement, digital transformation and learning and development.
* Manage content strategy: Develop, maintain and update content strategy and training materials to ensure they reflect current products, services, and sales strategies.
* Being a Thought leader: Represent the Talent and Global L&D teams as a Thought Leader in DLL Commercial and Sales.


**All members enjoy**
* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.


 “We create an inclusive workplace that unleashes the full potential of our members.”
   

  

**Essentials**
**Technical**
* Sales enablement: 8+ years of experience in sales training, sales enablement, or sales leader preferred
* Digital literacy: Skilled with digital tools and AI and ability to train others in those areas
* Cognitive processes: Understanding how people think, learn, and remember information.
* Learning design: Deep knowledge of instructional design and learning experience design, delivery and evaluation of effectiveness with a focus on adult learners
* Global matrix organization: Experience of working in an international, multi-cultural, and matrix environment would hasten your onboarding journey.
* Leasing and financial services: Previous industry experience in leasing, financial services a nice to have
* Change management: Experience with leading change projects
* Social learning theories: Familiarity with theories like Bandura's Social Learning Theory, which emphasizes learning through observation and modeling.


**Interpersonal**
* Active Listening: Paying attention to others' contributions and responding thoughtfully.
* Adaptability: Being open to new ideas and flexible in learning from different people and situations.
* Customer-centric: Ability to understand and focus on the needs of customers and key stakeholders in all learning-related activities and projects.
* Data-driven: Ability to analyze and interpret data for the purpose of impactful storytelling and reporting.
* Digital literacy: Ability to work with digital learning tools and applications, including genAI and other AI applications.
* Collaboration Skills: Ability to work well with others, including teamwork and cooperation.
* Communication Skills: Clear and effective communication is crucial for sharing ideas, feedback, and knowledge.
* Empathy: Understanding and sharing the feelings of others to foster a supportive learning environment.
* Results driven: Ability to deliver on set goals and objectives and do so on time and within budget.
* Problem-Solving Skills: Working together to find solutions to challenges.


 Choose wellbeing
   

  

 DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.
   

  

**Our Four Wellbeing Categories Are As Follows**
* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


 These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL
   

  

 Settling in
   

  

 At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.
   

  

 But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.
   

  

 Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.
   

  

 Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.
   

  

 We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind:
 **Partnering for a better world.**
**Good To Know**
* Deadline for application: 18th July 2025 (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* Dublin, Düsseldorf, Helsinki, København, Madrid, Oslo, Paris, Stockholm, Watford
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Dennis van Hoof via dennis.vanhoof@dllgroup.com


 DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.
   

  

 DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)**
 We are looking for a
 **Strategic Product Manager** 
 who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.
   

  

**When Joining Tietoevry Banking You Will Work On**
* Product Vision and Strategy: Develop and communicate a clear product vision and mid-term/long-term strategy that aligns with the company's overall Strategy, objectives and market trends. Define target customers, licensing and pricing models to address predictable long-term revenue flow. Define complementary services to support successful implementation and maintenance, ensure additional revenue flow.
* Market Analysis: Conduct in-depth market research to understand industry trends, competitive landscape, regulatory changes and customer needs, providing input and recommendations for strategic decisions for mid-term and long-term initiatives. Identify opportunities for product innovation and differentiation.
* Roadmap Development: Ability to translate market needs and business opportunities to a strategic roadmap and balance long/short-term needs. Create and maintain a high-level product roadmap that outlines key milestones, deliverables, and timelines, ensuring alignment with business priorities. Address product lifecycles, including planning sunsetting and migration strategies. Define innovation inception approaches. Plan portfolio modernization to fit market needs, ensure future growth and competitive costs.
* Relationship Building: Establish and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, partners, and industry influencers to create new business opportunities. Participate, present and be influencer in conferences, industry workgroups. Build relationships with industry stakeholders globally. Demonstrate cultural awareness and the ability to adapt product strategies to various regional requirements.
* Stakeholder management: Collaborate closely with the sales team and engage with other departments, including engineering, marketing, project management and customer teams, to support with sales and ensure successful product development and launch. Cooperate cross-units in Cards and Transaction Banking and other units in Banking.
* Customer Insights: Prepare and present vision, pitches, and presentations to existing and potential clients and partners, effectively communicating the value proposition. Gather and analyze customer feedback and usage data to inform product decisions and enhance user experience.
* Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and identify areas for improvement, ensure data-based decision making. Keep accountability on product/service profitability. Align models and use cross unit template and processes.
* Go-to-Market Strategy: Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market strategies for product launches and updates. Collaborate with Security, Compliance and Privacy teams to identify market or country potential risks and opportunities.
* Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.
* Leadership and Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to product managers and team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.


**Who We Are Looking For**
* A Bachelor's degree in business, Marketing, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience in product management, with a focus on strategic planning and execution.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience in Cards and Payments, with a large network of connections with industry experts and decision-makers.
* Familiarity with European and Nordic customers.


**We Also Believe You Have**
* Strong strategic thinking skills to develop and implement effective product strategies.
* A market and customer focus that drives product innovation and meets customer needs.
* Excellent relationship-building abilities to establish connections with clients, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Proficiency in public speaking to effectively present ideas and influence audiences.
* Strong negotiation and influencing skills to advocate for product initiatives and secure buy-in.
* A creative mindset that fosters innovation and the development of unique solutions.
* A results-oriented approach that emphasizes accountability and achievement of product goals.


 As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, an open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance!
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
* Competitive salary (up to 7,000 EUR gross per month in Latvia), based on experience and qualifications.
* Finally, we believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application! Interviews will be held continuously, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at recruitmentinbanking@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Rīga - Verde, Roberta Hirša 1
   

  

*On specific positions, we might perform background checks.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion, and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiarize yourself with what we do.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
   

  

 Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Senior Product Manager - Product Development
description:
Silex Microsystems is the world’s leading pure-play MEMS foundry, delivering customized solutions for top-tier clients in industries like pharmaceuticals, consumer electronics, and automotive. As a Senior Product Manager, you’ll help bring cutting-edge MEMS technologies from concept to market. Would you like to know more about Silex and what we do?
 *Read more here.*
 This job will be posted over the summer holidays, and we will start processing applications at the beginning of August.
   

  

****The Team****
 The Product Development team steps in where the Sales team leaves off, working closely with customers to transform innovative ideas into functional, production-ready products. We focus on delivering exceptional results during the concept and prototype phases, ensuring we meet and exceed client expectations.
   

  

 We’re a collaborative team of nearly 40 members, including Product Managers, CAD Engineers, and Process Design Engineers. Knowledge-sharing and teamwork are central to how we operate.
   

  

****The role****
 As a Senior Product Manager, you’ll take ownership of developing custom MEMS products in close collaboration with our customers and Silex’s Process Engineers. You'll guide the journey from concept through early production, ensuring the product meets the customer’s vision while setting up scalable production processes. This development cycle may span a few months to several years and results in products used across industries like Telecom, Life Sciences & Medical, Industrial & Automotive, and Consumer Devices.
   

  

 This role combines project management and technical expertise. As prototypes enter processing, you’ll often spend time in our cleanroom, or coordinating analyses of wafers with a junior colleague.
   

  

 You’ll report to a Group Manager within Product Development and work cross-functionally within Silex, as well as externally with customers. To ensure a strong start, you’ll receive hands-on training from an experienced colleague to familiarize you with our development process and tools.
   

  

****Your responsibilities****
* Act as the primary point of contact for customers during product development.
* Take technical ownership of new MEMS products.
* Lead failure analysis and troubleshooting activities.
* Drive process development, improvements, and documentation.
* Manage delivery plans, order portfolios, and contribute to strategic planning.
* Collaborate closely with internal teams and external stakeholders.


****What we’re looking for****
* Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, ideally with coursework in Material Physics, Nanotechnology, MEMS, or Material Chemistry.
* Experience with MEMS or CMOS technology through work or academic research.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to discuss technical topics in English, Swedish is considered highly beneficial as a lot of internal documentation is written in Swedish.
* Previous experience in customer-facing roles.
* Several years of experience in production environments, preferably in project management or process engineering roles.
* Familiarity with cleanroom or lab-based work.


****To succeed in the role, we also think that you are****
* A clear and adaptable communicator, able to engage both colleagues and customers
* Organized and methodical in how you drive projects forward
* Curious and eager to deepen your expertise in MEMS
* Business-minded and focused on delivering value to customers


**About The Recruitment Process**
 Due to our summer break, you can expect to hear from us regarding your application by mid-August. To apply, simply upload your CV or LinkedIn-profile and answer a few short questions.
   

  

 Our recruitment process is competency-based and includes a personality and logic ability assessment, as well as reference checks. Before employment, we also conduct a background check and drug screening.
   

  

**Silex** 
 is the world’s largest and most advanced pure-play MEMS foundry. With a team of expert engineers, operators, technicians, engineers, support staff, specialists, and much more besides, Silex transforms the visionary ideas of the world’s leading MEMS innovators into reality.
